reviewText: I rented this movie not sure of what I would get because I had heard absolutely nothing about it. The story contained all the elements that a "real" romance story should have. It was also free of negative stereotypes and "X" rated material that would prevent the entire family from enjoying. It started off slow for the first twenty minutes but it is important to see why the main character (Christian Keys) made the relationship decisions that he made. It is a terrific "date night" movie. It softens the heart and makes you want that "old fashioned" kind of love that is almost nonexistent these days. Please make more positive movies like this that the entire family can enjoy.
summary: Why can't it really be like this?

reviewText: It's nice to see finally, that two people who wants to love one another and make their relationship lasts, that they do not have sex. I assumed that they waited until they were married. If not, then to me, it doesn't matter if you wait for one, two, or even three years, and then have sex, you haven't accomplished much to me, because he still got what he wanted, and that was sex before marriage. Wait until he marries you my beautiful sister!! He might not be happy, but I'm quite sure that God will be. I did like the movie. I was glad to see that he realized that he was more than just a piece of meat. You can do anything that you put your mind to. If God is in it, he will give you his Grace to make it, whether you realize it at the time or not. I think that they complimented one another inside and out. I'm talking about Christian Keyes and Lotoya that is, not the first lady that he was with, who really didn't respect herself. All she saw, was that she was in control, how sad.
summary: Note to Self! If you can't wait until marrige, watch this movie.  This can, and has happened in real life. So sustain!! Pray!!!

reviewText: Curtis King (Christian Keyes) is a senior in college. He makes good grades, has a few close friends and he's dating. He has a good relationship with his mother (Valerie Pettiford) and ill feelings towards his absentee father (Richard T. Jones).Curtis wanted more out of life, and with the help of Dr. Thompson (Brian McKnight) he began to work through his issues. I was glad to see his growth. I also liked how close he was to his mother. The moments he spent with her were the best parts of this film. And everything going on with his father - those moments taught lessons of forgiveness and second chances.Some characters talked about sex as if it was the solution to every problem. It is not. And having sex simply for physical pleasure is not love-making. It is meaningless. I was especially glad to see Curtis' growth in this area. There is nothing wrong with a guy who chooses to wait to have sex. It was nice that this film sent this important message.There were parts that made me giggle, parts that were supposed to be funny but weren't tasteful and a scene or two that I found touching - an okay film.

reviewText: There are so many good reviews about this movie it's ridiculous and very true! I decided to tell everyone that this movie is no joke, it's just that awesome!I really enjoyed the directing and writing of this movie. I think the actors had a easy time playing their parts because everything was written so well. They casted great actors for the movie and all they needed to do is say their lines and it turned out awesome.The director had a easy time directing this movie because the script was done so well and there's no CGI or special effects to think about fitting into the movie. Also it wasn't needed because the story came first. It just shows you that with a great story makes can make a great movie without fancy CGI or effects.The movie has a deep and meaningful message that it shows throughout the movie. What I got out of it is that life has it's ups and downs and what you think might be bad could actually be good!I do recommend this movie!
summary: It's NOT a basketball movie - it's MUCH BETTER!!!
